source.title: Chenopodiaceae

leads.lead_text: Tepals and vegetative parts with rounded vesicular hairs only
Tepals (and to a lesser extent leaves and branchlets) covered in a mixture of glistening, hollow, curled-linear, branched and rounded vesicular hairs
Plants prostrate to decumbent, not spinescent; inflorescences usually shorter than leaves
Plants erect, often somewhat spinescent; inflorescences usually exceeding upper leaves
Leaves elliptic, ovate or nearly circular, often glabrescent above; plants not obviously odorous
Leaves narrow-elliptic, mealy pubescent on both surfaces; plants fetid when crushed
